tasks.task: Load hay onto a vehicle.
subtasks: Drive tractor with front-end loader.
Attach hay bales to the vehicle.
Safely drive the vehicle to a storage location.

tasks.task: Unload hay bales from a vehicle into a barn.
subtasks: Dismount the vehicle and approach the barn.
Manually carry hay bales up the barn stairs.
Place hay bales into designated storage areas.

tasks.task: Feed animals.
subtasks: Mix feed into a suitable container.
Distribute feed to the animals in their stalls or pens.

tasks.task: Check water supplies.
subtasks: Inspect water troughs or tanks.
Refill water containers as needed.

tasks.task: Maintain equipment.
subtasks: Inspect the condition of the tractor and loader.
Lubricate parts as necessary.
Check for loose or missing bolts.

tasks.task: Enter and exit the tractor safely.
subtasks: Adjust the seat and mirrors to the correct position.
Verify all controls are within reach.
Buckle the seat belt before starting.
Open the cab door while keeping balance.
Exit the tractor by reversing the entry process.

tasks.task: Operate the front-end loader to handle bales.
subtasks: Raise the loader bucket to pick up a hay bale.
Drive the tractor slowly to transport the bale.
Lower the bucket carefully near the vehicle.
Repeat for each bale needing transport.

tasks.task: Hoist hay bales onto the vehicle.
subtasks: Position the loader bucket around the bale.
Use the loader arms to lift the bale onto the vehicle.
Secure the bale with the vehicle's tie-downs if necessary.
Lower the loader bucket back to the ground.

tasks.task: Check the tire pressure of the tractor.
subtasks: Refer to the tires for the correct pressure levels.
Use a tire gauge to measure the pressure.
Add air if the pressure is below the minimum.
Dispose of any excess air.

tasks.task: Refuel the tractor.
subtasks: Locate the fuel access point on the tractor.
Connect the fueling hose to the tractor.
Monitor the fuel level until it reaches the desired mark.
Disconnect the hose and clean up any spills.

tasks.task: Consolidate hay bales into a windrow.
subtasks: Drive the tractor with the loader to the field.
Position the loader at the edge of a stack of hay.
Push the hay bales with the loader into a neat row.
Adjust the loader's height as needed for efficiency.

tasks.task: Conduct routine barn checks.
subtasks: Inspect the roof for any signs of leakage.
Check the walls for structural integrity.
Examine the flooring for stability and slip resistance.

tasks.task: Disinfect the barn area.
subtasks: Gather cleaning supplies such as brushes and disinfectant.
Apply disinfectant to surfaces and equipment.
Allow the disinfectant to dry or as per instructions.

tasks.task: Install or check water and feed automation systems.
subtasks: Walk through the barn to locate the system's control panel.
Ensure that all water and feed lines are properly connected.
Test the system to make sure it operates correctly.
Make adjustments or repairs if needed.
